channel.title: CiTR -- Shadow Jugglers
channel.description: The eclectic radio show Shadow Jugglers welcomes you to broaden your musical knowledge with DJs MP, Socool, Soo, & their guests. Shadow Jugglers works across musical genres including electronic and club-based music, presenting genres rarely introduced into main-stream musical culture. Travel through world sounds every Saturday from 7-9 PM. Respect.
channel.itunes:summary: The eclectic radio show Shadow Jugglers welcomes you to broaden your musical knowledge with DJs MP, Socool, Soo, & their guests. Shadow Jugglers works across musical genres including electronic and club-based music, presenting genres rarely introduced into main-stream musical culture. Travel through world sounds every Saturday from 7-9 PM. Respect.
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver
channel.itunes:subtitle: Drum n'Bass & Jungle.

item.title: Broadcast on 01-Aug-2009
item.description:
Hello to all Shadow Jugglers!
We've got a very special guest tonight hailing from Edmonton, Alberta. J-Roc has been ripping it up in the studio in the last several months dropping bomb after bomb on the unsuspecting public.
If funky breaks, hiphop, electro, and all-around bad-assness is what you're looking for, be sure to tune in tonight!
Support from DJ Soo!
J-ROC
[Good Groove Records/Rough Sawn Records/Sovereign House Records/Rockstar Tuesdays, Suite 69]
http://www.myspace.com/souldoutdj
Soul'd Out Dj's Have been killing it in the scene in Edmonton lately with their weekly "sould out" night, Rockstar Tuesday. Playing on 4 turntables and 2 mixers and remixing all your favorite dance classics from 50s to 80s to now, these guys have been packin' dance floors and blowin' minds since their arrival back in Canada two years ago. With musical influence ranging from anything from old school hip hop to house to old funk, new funk, these guys have devised a unique way of incorporating a little bit of everything into their sets. Jeremie Voillot (Dj Deliverance) and Jason Osborne (J-roc) have been long time buddy's playing clubs and parties around North and Central American and the Caribbean.
The Dj Deliverance and J-Roc coalition has opened for, and played along side some of the biggest names in the music industry. Some of Sould Out's latest tracks have hit the top 20 chart on beatport with others being played on air on the UK's biggest station KISS FM by Fabrics Dj ALI B. With 4 more releases soon to hit vinyl and a few more on the digital side, these guys are definitely helping to put Canada on the map for underground and club music.
Shadow Jugglers 101.9FM on CiTR Saturdays 7-9pm (PST) streaming at: www.citr.ca www.shadowjugglers.com
item.itunes:subtitle: J-ROC & Soo

item.title: Broadcast on 25-Jul-2009
item.description:
DJs 25.07.09
This week on Shadow Jugglers, we are pleased to present a double-feature of not one, but two special guests!
Buck Lee: playing an all vinyl old school set!
Buck Lee has been deejaying around the west coast for the last seven years. After first playing reggae and dub at raves he grew tired of waiting until the morning to play his sets. He then took up playing 2-step, later DnB, Jungle, Dancehall and more recently Dubstep. After relocating to Vancouver, Buck Lee is hard at work making tunes, playing parties and building up his reputation as an original badman on the decks.
Lady AK
Lady AKs love for music has been engraved in her soul since early childhood. Growing up with parents who were professional jazz musicians was a huge inspiration. At age of four she was enrolled at a local art school in Kiev, Ukraine where she immersed rhythmic, classical piano, music theory, and singing. After moving to Canada, at age of 16, Allas friend taught her the essentials of mixing, peaking her interest in DJing. Later in 1999 she got her first pair of turntables which came with a box-full of random records that gave her a head start.
It wasnt until 2004 that Alla took music business seriously. She swiftly compiled huge collection of tunes and since has been playing massive amount of club nights and raves in Canada, US and even Europe, with world known acts such as Dillinja, Lemon D, Hive, Breakage, Baby Anne, Kenny Ken, Third Eye Tribe, Malente, Capital J, T. Power, Uberzone, DJ Diamond, and so many more. It doesnt stop here. Lady AK has also been pushing the music industry through various club promotions, parties and festivals in BC.
This versatile dj will get you rolling with her fresh, wicked nu style of Jump Up, Liquid Drum n Bass, Electro & Bassline House, booty shacking & Funky Breaks as well as Dubcore Dubstep. Her collection contains many different genres of music to create proper dancing atmosphere for the audiences.
item.itunes:subtitle: Buck Lee and Lady AK

item.title: Broadcast on 27-Dec-2008
item.description:
This is our last show of 2008, so we're celebrating with a very special guest:
DJ Whitness - Taking the Northwest Drum n' Bass scene by storm, the beautiful and talented Whitness brings her love of Drum & Bass to the people. With her unique style of Smooth, Sexy Liquid Funk, and Slammin' Bass Lines, Whitness has smashed many dance floors, with even more to come in 2009.
We will also be featuring the latest mix by DJ Soo, an instant classic called Baby Boomer, which burned up the family Christmas dinner party circuit this holiday season.
Shadow Jugglers radio show Saturdays from 7-9 PM (PST) CiTR 101.9 FM in Vancouver, BC
Tune in or listen to the podcast you can find on CiTR 101.9 FM
Happy New Year!
WHITNESS - NorthWestJungle http://virb.com/djwhitness
SOO - Shadow Jugglers http://shadowjugglers.com http://www.woodnsoo.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Whitness & Soo

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Jul-2008
item.description:
Greetings!
Tonight we were joined in the studio by Fractal, a DJ, producer and sound designer based on the west coast. According to his bio on http://djfractal.net/:
~~~
Thor Fractal Kell sometimes confuses himself with both an abstract mathematical concept and a Norse god of thunder. Suspiciously enough, both of these themes show up in his music, along with a serious jones for science-fiction sounds and samples. He has been accused of being from the future, which he declines to comment on. Ask him about music, on the other hand, and you get a distinct reaction:
Genre isnt a big thing for me, he says, but feel and texture really are. I like things with a sense of space and myth and future, of being able to soundtrack some film about landing on other planets. If that happens to be a progressive track or a minimal techno record, or some pop song, so be it.
So be it indeed. As a DJ, his sets veer and twist to suit the circumstance: ambient and downtempo breaks on a beach at sunset, eclectro-disco bombs in an underground club, emotion and depth for a radio set. It all gets brought together with impeccable mixing, a desire to avoid the double cliche of just playing records, and an inch-perfect sense for the unexpected and delightful.
His production work waves that battle flag for the unexpected high. Video-game tech house tracks sit beside brooding progressive records, which are in turn bookended by heavy, heavy breaks, stompy battletech, and lush ambient works. The Fractal remix touch has been applied to Chris Fortier, AFK, and Blake Jarrell, along with netlabel favorites Spada, Russian Linesman, and Limbo. On the bootleg front, The Beatles, Libra, and The Streets are some of the notables that have found themselves the subjects of lovingly illicit reworks. In terms of originals, he can claim an EP of techy business on the mighty Mmmph netlabel, a release on Inaspace as one half of Royal Assassin, a terrifying breaks track on A:Loud, and four tracks signed to Primal Recordings. This, of course, to say nothing of his assortment of work for his own Tide Pool label.
Tide Pool is something of a story in and of itself. Suffice to say that it was started as a netlabel for leftfield masterworks, off-kilter dancefloor devastators, and general wonderment in late 2005 while Thor was in the throes of corporate disillusionment. Featuring the now familiar anything-goes music policy, Tide Pools first 10 releases made fans out of people like Jondi, James Holden, Cass, and Josh Wink, all the while amassing thousands of downloads. The label has recently relaunched with much pomp and fanfare - check it at tide-pool.ca
Thor currently lives in Victoria, BC, on the west coast of Canada. If hes not writing about himself in the 3rd person, you can probably find him playing or making music in his slowly-decomposing studio. He hopes you like what you hear.
~~~
With support from SJ resident DJ Soo!
item.itunes:subtitle: Fractal & Soo

item.title: Broadcast on 21-Jun-2008
item.description:
Tonight, we've got the one and only DJ Hubbz of Beatstreet Records playing a live set of funk, hiphop, breaks, grime, Reggae, Dancehall, and much more. Hubbz's mixtapes are perennial favourites in the Shadow Jugglers crew so be prepared for a treat!
Dj Socool kicks off the show with a set of drum'n'bass to celebrate the Solstice.
item.itunes:subtitle: DJ Hubbz & DJ Socool

item.title: Broadcast on 14-Jun-2008
item.description:
Shadow Jugglers sunny-day special!
Tonight we have veteran DJ Spilt Milk laying down an eclectic blend of funk, breaks, electro, and whatever else floats his boat. Spilt is one of our favorite guests to bring in... tune in to find out why! http://djspiltmilk.ca/
On the to of the hour, DJ MP will be laying down a set of dub reggae to warm up your speakers.
item.itunes:subtitle: Spilt Milk & MP

item.title: Broadcast on 07-Jun-2008
item.description:
DJ Soo plays a wild set of the musics, from dancehall to dubstep.
Hexadecibel drops a set of the deepest dubstep featuring his own works and lots of jams by a handful of local producers.
HxdB: Sound enthusiast, patient hand, steady eye, percussion molester... http://virb.com/hxdb
item.itunes:subtitle: Soo & Hexadecibel

item.title: Broadcast on 17-May-2008
item.description: Mp & Sexy Lucy present respectively the Dub/Reggae & the Dubstep. Hotta Hotta!!
item.itunes:subtitle: MP & Sexy Lucy

item.title: Broadcast on 10-May-2008
item.description:
Today we gots the Rudegals, mixing up some Dubstep'n'Drum'n'Jungle Bass Biznazz.
Socool: Make it Splicey
MP: The Skip
item.itunes:subtitle: Rudegals

item.title: Broadcast on 03-May-2008
item.description:
Today we have a very special treat for the listeners of Shadow Jugglers: All 6 of the SHAH djs will be featured over the 2 hour show!
Holistic JoeAve Decibel Point Kir Mokum Eradik J.F. Killah
http://www.shahdjs.com
Tune in to hear some fresh drum'n'bass styles... and a chance to win tix to Visionary on the 17th!
item.itunes:subtitle: SHAH DJS!!

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Apr-2008
item.description:
Excellent Radio with DJ 'mash up' Soo, DJ Junglette MP and our special guest from the Sunshine Coast, Noradawn.
Tune in!
item.itunes:subtitle: Soo, MP & Noradawn

item.title: Broadcast on 19-Apr-2008
item.description:
MP and Socool start the show with some old faves and plus showcase of their production as the Rudegals.
Special guest Neighbour from Calgary treats us to a selection of some of his finest tracks, featuring collaborations with Spilt Milk & Piper Davis. Electrodiscoboogiemagoria!
The one like Spilt Milk drops some tracks to close the show
item.itunes:subtitle: Neighbour / Spilt Milk / Rudegals

item.title: Broadcast on 12-Apr-2008
item.description:
TONIGHT, the Shadow Jugglers residents (DJs MP, Soo & Socool) are pleased to welcome SirBassa!
To know more about SirBassa, visit www.sirbassa.com :
Sean "SirBassa" Hill is a musician/composer, performer, DJ and producer of modern electronic-dub-roots, trancehall and dance music based on Saltspring Island, BC. Mostly, he plays heavy BASS... He is part of the INTERCHILL Records tribe as a resident DJ, event coordinator and recording artist. As an integral part of the renowned INTERCHILL nights on Saltspring, he is responsible for production and sound @ all events.
For the past 16 years he has recorded in Kingston, Jamaica, Montreal, Quebec, Salt Spring Island and Vancouver, BC, creating reggae/dub influenced music with forays into Eastern soundscapes, trancedub and downtempo electronica. He has also been working with GANGA GIRI for the last 4 years, recording, performing and booking tours. Past performances include festivals such as Vancouver Folkfest, Under The Volcano, EarthDance, Shambhala, Diversity, Invision, StarBelly Jam, Soundwave, Symbiosis & Open Air and numerous club gigs and hall shows...
Consider this a warm-up for the wonderful Dubforms party @ Open Studios this evening. See you there!
item.itunes:subtitle: Featuring SirBassa of Big Bass Theory

item.title: Broadcast on 05-Apr-2008
item.description: Shadow Jugglers welcomes special guest Sinesthetix dropping a scorching set of drum n bass running the gamut of liquid funk to all out techstep bangers. DJ MP plays selecta playing a diverse set of reggae and dancehall while Soo does his soo-thing. yea.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shadow Jugglers feat. Sinesthetix

item.title: Broadcast on 22-Mar-2008
item.description:
The Shadow Jugglers are pleased to present the Tremendous Two - yes, yes you know it:
Wood'n'Soo!!
Doin' that genre-bending thing they do pon the decks, and giving us an update on their upcoming tour plus keeping us in the know about their new night, the Down Stoke: Thursday nights at Library Square.
item.itunes:subtitle: Wood'n'Soo

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Feb-2008
item.description:
You are listening to Shadow Jugglers on 101.9fm CiTR... Today we have for you a very special treat: 2 hours of fine beats for you listening enjoyment:
Hour 1: The SJ Hoodlums (MP, Socool & Soo) give you a taste of some of their favourite flavourings of the last while
Hour 2: Xan presents... The Story So Far, a live mashup of original compositions for dance.
item.itunes:subtitle: Xan / SJ Crew

item.title: Broadcast on 12-Jan-2008
item.description:
Shadow Jugglers residents Socool & Soo present Down by the Bayside, an improvised tag-team set showcasing the kind of music you'll hear at their Mixdown Tuesdays residency at Bayside Lounge.
And keeping the show true to its roots, MP drops a blazing set of Old School Jungle.
Much respect to Huajah, a true SJ souljah, keepin us company in the studio.
item.itunes:subtitle: Socool vs Soo / MP

item.description: Yes yes that's right we have the return of one of our favorite Shadow Jugglers, the one & only DJ Dubconscious lays down some slick new reggae riddims, followed by a strong selection of drum & bass. Up next we have Noradawntribe smashing it up with some more d'n'b, before Jim Turns of Northwestjungle.com steps up to the wheels of steel, yes the platters that matter, with some catchy dnb & jungle bits. blaooooow!

item.description: MP Coast to Coast starts the show with some French dub flavas, transitioning into intelligent drum'n'bass and jungle - warming up the airwaves for our special guest, DJ Hydra - who lays down a thick and chunky set of impeccably mixed drum'n'bass.

Whitney warms up the show with some tres hot drum'n'bass, and DJ Soo smokes out the place with his usual stellar stound.

Rippin pon da decks

item.title: Broadcast on 30-Dec-2006
item.description:
This is our last show of 2006. You didn't think we'd let that slip by without comin' correct with a proper jam, now did ya?
Down at Fixed Fridays, he made us all proud to be junglists. The music ended with people with their hands up in the air, wanting more. So, how about some more?
Shadow Jugglers is pleased to present: Marcus Visionary
With the Jugglers: Bias MP Socool It's been a fantastic year musically and otherwise. Here's to 2007 being even better!
item.itunes:subtitle: Marcus Visionary in the house!

item.title: Broadcast on 23-Dec-2006
item.description:
December 23rd = SJ X-Mas Special What to give you in this season of generosity? I know: Lots of deep, dark and dirty beats'n'bass.
Bias & Soo bring it. Now's it's yours for the taking.
item.itunes:subtitle: Bias & Soo

item.title: Broadcast on 09-Dec-2006
item.description: Bias & Ill-Esha
item.itunes:subtitle: Bias & Ill-Esha

item.title: Broadcast on 18-Nov-2006
item.description:
Featuring Hayze & Luke Freedom for last half of the show. This is their first time playing on SJ. With Luke Freedom throwing down D&B and Breaks & Hayze ending the night off with some DUB and Downtempo, brings a perfect blend of variety to the show.
The SJ Residents rip it up during the first 45 minutes with Bias throwing down mad Dubstep tunes and MP coast-to-coast exploring the Jungle side of the electronic music.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hayze, Luke Freedom, Bias & MP

item.title: Broadcast on 14-Nov-2006
item.description:
***Shadow Jugglers Special Edition*** (Available via podcast exclusively)
Is it midweek? Does Saturday night seem like an oasis in the far off distance?
Well, you're in luck.
We've trecked out to the studio on a foggy Tuesday night in order to compile this celebration of beats & basslines, and so now you'll have a little sump'n to tide over your appetite until next Saturday.
MP Coast to Coast starts off the show with some of the best damn jungle this side of the Amazon. Vancouver legend Noradawntribe follows the deep rhythms and inner pulsations of the core of the earth, and it might just shake you down to your own foundations. Socool drops some choons, cos she does that sometimes. And finally, DJ Soo closes the show with an epic birthday set, guaranteed to make you wiggle.
item.itunes:subtitle: MP, Noradawn, Socool & Soo

item.title: Broadcast on 11-Nov-2006
item.description:
Lady AK is our special guest this week. Check out her set during the second hour, it's 100% bad ass beats!
The SJ Residents tag it up during the first hour, throwing down mad tunes and attempting to get you to loosen your purse strings ; )
item.itunes:subtitle: Lady AK, Bias, MP & Socool

item.title: Broadcast on 04-Nov-2006
item.description:
It's November and it's raining.
No worries, though. It's hot up in the CiTR studio, and that's what matters.
DJ Soo makes with the heady junglisms for the first bit. DJ C-Squared, this week's feature guest, mashes up those heavy growley beats he loves so much. Don't forget to find out more info on those ticket giveaways on http://www.nwdnb.bc.ca aight? Socool ends it in a flurry of syncopated beats.
item.itunes:subtitle: DJ C-Squared & DJ Soo

item.title: Broadcast on 21-Oct-2006
item.description:
This week marks the return of BIAS! Tune in for all the new tunes, including the parallel return of Dillinja. Biashment, I'm tellin' ya.
Oh no no, that's not all. We have for you a special guest, Kir Mokum, hot off the Fixed Fridays decks and ready to bring the tunes.
Socool ends the show by doing what she does best: Kickin' it back to the OLD SKOOL cos she's an OLD FOOL who's SOCOOL.
Bring on the beats.
item.itunes:subtitle: Kir Mokum, Bias & Socool

item.title: Broadcast on 14-Oct-2006
item.description:
Featuring Dubconscious (TO, Vic - formerly Gimpy J - myspace.com/sketchyjake) laying down those smooth jungle tunes.
Termite & MP Coast to Coast lock down the second hour with some freaky techstep and reggae, respectively.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dubconscious, Termite, MP Coast to Coast

item.title: Broadcast on 07-Oct-2006
item.description:
The first episode available for download features the zesty dj soo (You know how he do). He's pretty much an honorary Shadow Juggler anyway, so who better to feature on this exciting landmark show?!
Dj Socool melodic jungles out the last hour.
item.itunes:subtitle: Podcast #1: Soo & Socool
